message.content:
## Initial Candidates

Stage 1 identified the following candidates based on white cap, white gills, ring, bulbous base with sack-like structure, and oak tree association:

- **Death Cap (Amanita phalloides)** — high confidence — classic volva + ring + oak habitat
- **Field Mushroom (Agaricus campestris)** — low confidence — white cap with ring, but safety inclusion
- **Horse Mushroom (Agaricus arvensis)** — low confidence — white cap, ring, grassland

## Verification

### Death Cap (Amanita phalloides)
| Feature | You described | Dataset says | Verdict |
|---------|--------------|-------------|--------|
| Cap colour | white | olive green to dirty yellow, occasionally pale/white | PARTIAL MATCH |
| Gills | white | white to cream, free | MATCH |
| Ring | ring on stem | prominent skirt-like ring | MATCH |
| Stem base | bulbous base with sack | bulbous with large sac-like volva | MATCH |
| Habitat | under oak | broadleaf woodland, especially oak and beech | MATCH |

**Overall**: Strong match — all described features align with Death Cap
**Edibility**: DEADLY — contains amatoxins causing fatal liver failure

### Field Mushroom (Agaricus campestris)
| Feature | You described | Dataset says | Verdict |
|---------|--------------|-------------|--------|
| Cap colour | white | white to grey-brown | MATCH |
| Gills | white | deep pink when young, darkening to dark brown | CONTRADICTION |
| Stem base | bulbous with sack | no volva, no sack structure | CONTRADICTION |

**Overall**: ELIMINATED — white gills contradict Field Mushroom (gills should be pink), and sack-like volva is absent in Agaricus
**Elimination reason**: White gills and presence of volva are incompatible with Agaricus campestris

## Assessment

This is almost certainly **Amanita phalloides (Death Cap)** — the most deadly mushroom in the world. The combination of white gills, ring, bulbous base with volva, and oak habitat is diagnostic. A single cap contains enough amatoxins to kill an adult. Symptoms are delayed 6-24 hours after ingestion, by which time severe liver and kidney damage has already begun. Do not eat this mushroom.

## What Would Help

Dig carefully around the very base of the stem and confirm the volva (sac-like cup). Take a spore print on dark paper — Death Cap produces a white spore print. Does the mushroom have a faint sweet or honey-like smell?

## Safety Notes

⚠️ **CRITICAL WARNING**: Do not eat this mushroom under any circumstances. The features you describe are the hallmark of Amanita phalloides (Death Cap), which is deadly and fatal. There is no reliable antidote. Symptoms appear after a delay of 6-24 hours, by which time organ damage is already occurring. If you or anyone has consumed a mushroom matching this description, seek emergency medical attention immediately and bring a sample.
